column2: This provides statistics on guest night numbers, capacity and occupancy rates of hotels, motels, backpacker accommodation, and holiday parks in New Zealand each month. These statistics are used by regional tourism organisations, local and national government and the accommodation industry for monitoring and planning.

column2: These releases contain information on farming in New Zealand - including livestock and arable farming, horticulture, and forestry. Agricultural production statistics are produced in collaboration with the Ministry for Primary Industries.

column2: These releases provide estimates of the quantity of alcoholic beverages and tobacco available for consumption in New Zealand. As the tobacco available for consumption series was discontinued in September 2010, for reasons of confidentiality, the release title was changed accordingly.
column24: Infoshare: to view & download time-series data

column2: The ongoing Annual Enterprise Survey (AES) is New Zealand's most comprehensive source of financial statistics and provides annual financial performance and financial position information about business operation within New Zealand. Its coverage is around 80% of New Zealand's Gross Domestic Product (GDP).

column1: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position
column2: These statistics provide records of the value of the country's transactions with the rest of the world in goods, services, income, and transfers. They also record changes in New Zealand's financial claims on (assets), and liabilities to, the rest of the world
column5: Balance of payments, Economy, Imports and exports

column2: These measure the number of births  registered in New Zealand. Birth and statistics provide local authorities, health authorities, and research institutions with information needed to plan future and current social services.

column2: This information release contains statistics on consents for residential and non-residential buildings by region and building type. It includes the number, value and floor area of new residential dwellings, and the value of consents for residential alterations and additions. It also includes the value of consents for non-residential buildings, and the floor area of new non-residential buildings
column25: Subject category: Industry sectors, and Group: Building consents - BLD

column2: These releases provide information on business activity in New Zealand, by industry. The Business Activity Indicator is derived from goods and services tax (GST) data. These releases were suspended in 2002.

The Business Operations Survey is to collect performance measures from New Zealand businesses to better understand the practices and behaviours they undertake which may have an impact on their performance. These statistics feed into policy and micro data research that helps identify the current situation of the New Zealand business environment, as well as potential areas of improvement. The survey covers all businesses in New Zealand that have 6 more employees, and have been active for one year or more.
column5: Business, Economy, Industries, Information, and communication technology
column15: Business, Economy, Industries, Information and communication technology, Research and development
column24: Infoshare: to view & download time-series data
column25: Select Subject category: Business and Group: Business operations survey - BUO

column2: This combines the producers price index (PPI) and capital goods price index (CGPI) information releases into one quarterly business price index information release.   The PPI provides information on the change in the general level of prices for the productive sector of New Zealand. The CGPI provides information on changes in the general price level of fixed capital assets.
column5: Agriculture, Business, Economy, Industries, Price indexes
column25: Select Subject category: Economic indicators, and Group: Producers price index - PPI or Group: Capital goods price index - CEP.  Select Subject category: Industry sectors and Group: Farm inputs - FPI
